#summary Instructions on how to install the pygraphics libraries and dependecies
#labels Featured

= Introduction =

These are intermediate instructions before the distutils installer is
available.
NOTE: these instructions are specific to the Windows OS


= Details =

*Step 1:*
    
    Install [http://www.python.org/download/ Python 2.5]

*Step 2:*

    Install [http://effbot.org/downloads/#PIL PIL python library for Python 2.5]

*Step 3:*

    Install [http://pygame.org/download.shtml pygame python library for Python 2.5]

*Step 4:*

    Install [http://rene.f0o.com/%7Erene/stuff/Numeric-24.2.win32-py2.5.exe Numeric python library for Python 2.5]
    (For 2.4 and earlier: http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=1369)

*Step 5:*

    Install [http://www.speech.kth.se/snack/dist/snack2210-py.zip tkSnack:]
        * Copy the following 4 files from the downloaded .zip archive to your local python directory (substitute the "C:\Python25" with your python root)
{{{
    C:\Python25\Lib\tkSnack.py
    C:\Python25\tcl\snacklib\libsnack.dll
    C:\Python25\tcl\snacklib\snack.tcl
    C:\Python25\tcl\snacklib\pkgIndex.tcl
}}}

*Step 6:*

    Copy the media.py and turtle.py files, available from Source into your python
    root folder (ie. C:\Python25)

*Step 7:*
    Start python and type: {{{from media import *}}}

Congradulations! You can now use the PyGraphics library and tools.
